content.body: i'd like a sentinel value for an internal field to mean "not present" in StructuredSerialize, and would like to avoid using JS undefined, as this value is never supposed to escape to script

content.body: maybe that's preferable

annevk: I checked and destination for `prefetch` is empty (like regular fetch). I think this makes some sense. Prefetch is not a destination in itself - we don't know where the request is going to be end up. It's kind of like fetching the resource in a service worker
content.formatted_body: annevk: I checked and destination for prefetch is empty (like regular fetch). I think this makes some sense. Prefetch is not a destination in itself - we don't know where the request is going to be end up. It's kind of like fetching the resource in a service worker

content.body:
> <@annevk:matrix.org> Noam Rosenthal: initiator just has a few values to match some known use cases, but it doesn't really have a design

We just want to expose `prefetch` a a purpose, not the whole concept of initiator

content.body: Noam Rosenthal: what is the use case?
content.formatted_body: Noam Rosenthal: what is the use case?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Noam Rosenthal: what is the use case?
Noam Rosenthal: what is the use case?

content.body: annevk: it allows servers to opt-out of being prefetched, or to change their max-age so that a prefetched page doesn't expire, and also to not count prefetches towards "success rate" of loading a page
content.formatted_body: annevk: it allows servers to opt-out of being prefetched, or to change their max-age so that a prefetched page doesn't expire, and also to not count prefetches towards "success rate" of loading a page

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: annevk: it allows servers to opt-out of being prefetched, or to change their max-age so that a prefetched page doesn't expire, and also to not count prefetches towards "success rate" of loading a page

annevk: it allows servers to opt-out of being prefetched, or to change their max-age so that a prefetched page doesn't expire, and also to not count prefetches towards "success rate" of loading a page

content.body: I think the latter is perhaps the most common use case
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I think the latter is perhaps the most common use case

content.body: annevk: the latter is important for more than analytics... some web pages rely on "you visited this page last at..." for all sorts of things. without deferring between a prefetch and a regular document fetch, that kind of data gets messed up
content.formatted_body: annevk: the latter is important for more than analytics... some web pages rely on "you visited this page last at..." for all sorts of things. without deferring between a prefetch and a regular document fetch, that kind of data gets messed up

content.body: Does anyone know why I can suddenly no longer use [=origin=] or [=/origin=] to refer to the HTML origin concept in ReSpec? i.e. https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/browsers.html#concept-origin
